entries.text: If your vision board has “CTO” smack-dab in the middle, then this role is your natural next move. In this hands-on role, you’ll delve further into the wonderful world of team leadership. You’ll have the chance to gain experience with Go/Go-lang, develop your managerial chops, and did we mention lakeside lunchtime picnics? You bring the tea and sandwiches; we’ll take care of the lake.
entries.title: When your Day Job is a Walk in the Park

entries.text: You’ll be working for a Pittsburgh-based hosting company, well-known and well-respected within Perl circles. Serving over 120 countries worldwide and with their skin in the game for a quarter century, you’ll be joining a squad with a smorgasbord of coding talent helping a plethora of businesses at scale.
entries.title: Put your Perl skills into action in a young, green city that leaves more greenbacks in your pocket.

entries.text: If you’re a full stack developer whose interest leans more towards front-end work, this role is a great opportunity for you to sharpen and deepen your front-end skills while still keeping your toes in the back-end world of Perl.
entries.title: Front-end focus for a full stack Perl developer

entries.text: An Irvine, California-based software company is looking for developers to help revolutionize and democratize the job recruitment game. If you’re proficient in Perl and enthusiastic about other platforms, such as React or Angular on front-end and Node.js or Python on backend, this could be your opportunity to streamline the job market by helping recruiters make better decisions about candidates.
entries.title: Revolutionize and Democratize the Job Recruitment Game

entries.text: The company is looking for modern Perl developers with a strong interest in Python. You won’t just be showing off your skills, you’ll be able to expand and build upon them too. Fancy putting your good genes to use in one of England’s smartest, most beautiful cities? Want a role that has a tremendously positive impact on society? Get in touch, and let’s get you making a difference.
entries.title: Sick of jobs lacking purpose? This Perl job literally cures the world’s ills

header: So the Perl Weekly Challenge - has an awesome impact. It encouraged a number of people who have never blogged anything about Perl, to publish articles week by week. It brought out some of the old-timers from their caves. It even managed to get Damian Conway to write more frequently. It is clearly the project with the biggest positive impact on the Perl community in recent years.
Check out the web-site to get more information and also to read about Mohammad S. Anwar, the man behind the PWC. How he got into programming
